Name: Group statue of Wah-ib with his wife Tery and son
Description: The head, right lower arm and tips of the feet of the man as well as the head of the child are missing. The couple are sitting on a seat with a low backrest. They are joined by a high backplate. Their feet are placed on a protruding base. Between their legs is a boy.Wah-ib is embracing his wife with his left arm, his right hand is lying flat on his upper thigh. He is wearing an ankle-length kilt. Tery is seated in the same way but in mirror image. She is wearing a close-fitting long garment and a long black wig. The boy is wearing a short kilt.
